lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: Okay, stupid question time. What would happen if we ran our Explorers in the initial scouting phase of combat, the spot that the Aphelion proposal was targeting? I assume that we'd lose positioning for having to pull them back after that to reposition to re-enter the more main combat phases, but... Explorers are, as far as I can tell, fast and stealthy even in absolute terms, they have our best sensors, and malfean stealth is a thing. Would it balance?

lines.author: Oneiros
lines.content: I wouldn't really allow it - and if I did I'd start making checks for scout ships getting ambushed and the like to balance it

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: @Briefvoice The bot is a standard command line tool. Address it by its username, a command like `/help`, then a series of option-value pairs like `--start 'word words words'`.

lines.author: Briefvoice
lines.content: @vebyast-quote-bot-tbg /help copy many words

lines.author: vebyast-quote-bot-tbg
lines.content:
```usage: @vebyast-quote-bot-tbg /command [arguments]

A bot for saving quotes from a discord server.

Available commands:

  /add            Add a quote to the database
  /remove         Remove a quote from the database
  /get            Print out a quote from the database
  /clean          Clean up this bot's output
  /help           Output this message

Issue "@vebyast-quote-bot-tbg /command --help" for help with each individual command.

Quotes uploaded using this bot can be viewed at https://to-boldly-go.github.io/discord-quotes/index.html.
```

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: If you have a log that you can't locate by word search, either because it's old or not unique enough, you can turn on discord's developer mode to get message ids.

lines.author: Briefvoice
lines.content: Ehhhhh.

lines.author: Briefvoice
lines.content: How do I tell it what I want it to copy?

lines.author: Briefvoice
lines.content: @vebyast-quote-bot-tbg /addIf you have a log that you can't locate by word search, either because it's old or not unique enough, you can turn on discord's developer mode to get message ids.

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: Treat the bot like you would a piece of paperwork or a spreadsheet, it is as dumb as a brick and will do precisely what you tell it to and no more.

lines.author: Briefvoice
lines.content: Nope, that didn't work.

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: A log is defined by a start and an end.

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: Everything inside that including the start and end, gets copied.

lines.author: Briefvoice
lines.content: Okay... how do I identify the start and the end?

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: A value is exactly a single word or a string delimited by single quotes 'like this is a single value'.

lines.author: Briefvoice
lines.content: Okay, I think I had basically the right text, but I'm not putting spaces int he right locations or something?

lines.author: Briefvoice
lines.content: like, does there have to be a space between --start_id and the ID number?

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: Yes.

lines.author: Briefvoice
lines.content: @vebyast-quote-bot-tbg /add --start_id 356479753705750541 --end_id356480698619527170

lines.author: vebyast-quote-bot-tbg
lines.content: ```one of the arguments -E/--end_id -e/--end is required ```

lines.author: vebyast
lines.content: You also need to specify a channel unless you're quoting out of the current channel. You do t hi s with the --channel option, and you type in and autocomplete the channel name with the #

lines.author: Nix
lines.content: Which snakepit options require infrastructure points? Clearly starbases, shipyards, shipyard expansions and outposts (when available) do. Probably also colonies, academy expansions and listening posts. Abstract things like threat, militarisation and reorgs probably don't. What about tech teams, critical infrastructure, heavy industrial parks?
